title: What is normalization in DBMS?
subject: DBMS
answer: Normalization organizes data into smaller related tables to reduce redundancy and improve data integrity.

title: What is an array?
subject: DSA
answer: An array is a collection of elements stored in contiguous memory locations.

title: What is OS scheduling?
subject: OS
answer: Scheduling decides the order in which processes access the CPU.

title: What is a primary key?
subject: DBMS
answer: A primary key uniquely identifies each record in a table.

title: What is recursion?
subject: DSA
answer: Recursion is when a function calls itself to solve smaller subproblems.
